item.title: Close
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

Project Realm:

Search on Google for something like “Avira open port” or “Avira forward port” and if you find any articles about allowing a port to open on your computer, follow them. At this point, you have to allow Avira to not block port 43594. Once that’s done, you should be good to go. As long as your router port forwarding is correct and the anti-virus port forwarding is correct, then your server should be good to go.

Can you come onto my TeamViewer, and help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Close
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

Alright, well there can be a few reasons why it didn’t work.

  1. Your ISP is blocking 43594, which is highly unlikely.
  2. Your router is blocking 43594, which means you have to port forward (go to portforward.com and follow the instructions for your given router - pretty self explanatory)
  3. Your firewall is blocking 43594, in which case you have to tell it to stop blocking that port (it all depends on what kind of firewall you have)
  4. Your server isn’t listening to 43594, in which case you have to edit the code to make it listen to that port.

I would start with #2 (port forwarding), then #3 (firewall forwarding), then try to do the test again WHILE running the server. If it still doesn’t work, post on here again.

Read full topic

Project Realm:

That’s the problem then. Run your server, and then once it’s completely loaded, go to the website and do the test again.

item.title: Close
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

[quote=“Project Realm, post:2, topic:359779”]Are you sure your port is forwarded correctly, as well as your No-ip? Here’s a way to check:

Run your server, then go to “www.canyouseeme.org”. Type in your port into the text box, and click “Check.” The result should be that your port is forwarded correctly, but if not, you have to port forward.[/quote]

Error: I could not see your service on ...*** on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

Read full topic

item.title: Close
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

Are you sure your port is forwarded correctly, as well as your No-ip? Here’s a way to check:

Run your server, then go to “www.canyouseeme.org”. Type in your port into the text box, and click “Check.” The result should be that your port is forwarded correctly, but if not, you have to port forward.

Read full topic
